applied by Yakko Majuri","details":"Implementation of the `IERC777` interface. * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using `_mint`. * Support for ERC20 is included in this contract, as specified by the EIP: both the ERC777 and ERC20 interfaces can be safely used when interacting with it. Both `IERC777.Sent` and `IERC20.Transfer` events are emitted on token movements. * Additionally, the `granularity` value is hard-coded to `1`, meaning that there are no special restrictions in the amount of tokens that created, moved, or destroyed. This makes integration with ERC20 applications seamless. ","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See `IERC20.allowance`.     * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See `IERC20.approve`.     * Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators."},"authorizeOperator(address)":{"details":"See `IERC777.authorizeOperator`."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Returns the amount of tokens owned by an account (`tokenHolder`)."},"burn(uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See `IERC777.burn`.     * Also emits a `Transfer` event for ERC20 compatibility."},"constructor":{"details":"`defaultOperators` may be an empty array."},"decimals()":{"details":"See `ERC20Detailed.decimals`.     * Always returns 18, as per the [ERC777 EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-777#backward-compatibility)."},"defaultOperators()":{"details":"See `IERC777.defaultOperators`."},"distributeTokens(address)":{"details":"Function can only be called by DocumentRegistration contract - Only way to get tokens"},"granularity()":{"details":"See `IERC777.granularity`.     * This implementation always returns `1`."},"isOperatorFor(address,address)":{"details":"See `IERC777.isOperatorFor`."},"name()":{"details":"See `IERC777.name`."},"operatorBurn(address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"See `IERC777.operatorBurn`.     * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events."},"operatorSend(address,address,uint256,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"See `IERC777.operatorSend`.     * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events."},"pauseTransfers()":{"details":"Can only be called by 'FeePool' contract when dividend payout period is activated"},"revokeOperator(address)":{"details":"See `IERC777.revokeOperator`."},"send(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"See `IERC777.send`.     * Also emits a `Transfer` event for ERC20 compatibility."},"symbol()":{"details":"See `IERC777.symbol`."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See `IERC777.totalSupply`."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See `IERC20.transfer`.     * Unlike `send`, `recipient` is _not_ required to implement the `tokensReceived` interface if it is a contract.     * Also emits a `Sent` event."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See `IERC20.transferFrom`.    * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators).    * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events."}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"changeBurnPermissions()":{"notice":"Switch coordinating if burning tokens is allowed, burning is diabled by default"},"distributeTokens(address)":{"notice":"Sends number of tokens specified by 'allocation' to user"},"pauseTransfers()":{"notice":"Switch coordinating if transfers are currently allowed"},"setDocumentRegistration(address)":{"notice":"Sets address of 'DocumentRegistration' contract"},"setPoolAddress(address)":{"notice":"Sets address of 'FeePool' contract"},"setTokenAllocation(uint256)":{"notice":"Token allocation refers to how many tokens a user will gain from interacting with 'DocumentRegistration'"}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/contracts/CertfyToken.sol":"CertfyToken"},"evmVersion":"petersburg","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/contracts/CertfyToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5b2fc00c71eedbf28417f539f0c2bb5e4584253fcd3f50f61c13b5ad7afb5501","urls":["bzzr://371cec932d84d8449263efb8ab724f515bd1dc4d3fa9bead7476f7951f9a37b7"]},"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/lib/introspection/IERC1820Registry.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5142614bba04a88c3d9eb296402e89e6eee1fae0e59bb4ee3ec8b185990c8ea4","urls":["bzzr://f70b76e84529c15ce0429b56378238a2816501088a1f6de18808ed69c92b6e9b"]},"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/lib/math/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4ccf2d7b51873db1ccfd54ca2adae5eac3b184f9699911ed4490438419f1c690","urls":["bzzr://1604f5b6d6e916c154efd8c6720cda069e5ba32dfa0a9dedf2b42e5b02d07f89"]},"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/lib/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x90e8c2521653bbb1768b05889c5760031e688d9cd361f167489b89215e201b95","urls":["bzzr://aa8b45b57edafc3d67bc5d916327ea16807fae33f753ca163ae0c4061b789766"]},"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/lib/token/ERC777/IERC777.sol":{"keccak256":"0x18023ec802bd777927a0288b622b0b03eeb856f364a2a20823d84d6dcef887ab","urls":["bzzr://f1b76886ee6c0c013a2f1207697340bc21a46d84365fbff4caeff8f27b010900"]},"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/lib/token/ERC777/IERC777Recipient.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6a5862ca0e69a6b4a9f0a93c7b08c163258e2dfc27c646524cfc3fa68f8b7355","urls":["bzzr://24bcb73bf2c2ab0f5186d81cfabab44e399ad4620be1dc2af97a21aa94989e34"]},"/Users/yakkomajuri/GitHub/bootcamp-finalproject/eth/lib/token/ERC777/IERC777Sender.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1782d29894a11c6a7c7f9664ff5e5a88781697127e6584bbe9d65074f4f8ab34","urls":["bzzr://8bc3bf783239bbc615312d9f9d9257c6034a3cd71129b1 nodes.documentation:
@dev Implementation of the `IERC777` interface.
 * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means
that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using `_mint`.
 * Support for ERC20 is included in this contract, as specified by the EIP: both
the ERC777 and ERC20 interfaces can be safely used when interacting with it.
Both `IERC777.Sent` and `IERC20.Transfer` events are emitted on token
movements.
 * Additionally, the `granularity` value is hard-coded to `1`, meaning that there
are no special restrictions in the amount of tokens that created, moved, or
destroyed. This makes integration with ERC20 applications seamless.

 * @author Modifications applied by Yakko Majuri

nodes.documentation:
@dev See `IERC20.transferFrom`.
    * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot
call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with
allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators).
    * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.

devdoc.details: Implementation of the `IERC777` interface. * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using `_mint`. * Support for ERC20 is included in this contract, as specified by the EIP: both the ERC777 and ERC20 interfaces can be safely used when interacting with it. Both `IERC777.Sent` and `IERC20.Transfer` events are emitted on token movements. * Additionally, the `granularity` value is hard-coded to `1`, meaning that there are no special restrictions in the amount of tokens that created, moved, or destroyed. This makes integration with ERC20 applications seamless.

allowance(address,address).details: See `IERC20.allowance`.     * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves.

approve(address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.approve`.     * Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by an account (`tokenHolder`).

burn(uint256,bytes).details: See `IERC777.burn`.     * Also emits a `Transfer` event for ERC20 compatibility.

decimals().details: See `ERC20Detailed.decimals`.     * Always returns 18, as per the [ERC777 EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-777#backward-compatibility).

distributeTokens(address).details: Function can only be called by DocumentRegistration contract - Only way to get tokens

pauseTransfers().details: Can only be called by 'FeePool' contract when dividend payout period is activated

send(address,uint256,bytes).details: See `IERC777.send`.     * Also emits a `Transfer` event for ERC20 compatibility.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.transfer`.     * Unlike `send`, `recipient` is _not_ required to implement the `tokensReceived` interface if it is a contract.     * Also emits a `Sent` event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.transferFrom`.    * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators).    * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.

changeBurnPermissions().notice: Switch coordinating if burning tokens is allowed, burning is diabled by default

distributeTokens(address).notice: Sends number of tokens specified by 'allocation' to user

pauseTransfers().notice: Switch coordinating if transfers are currently allowed

setTokenAllocation(uint256).notice: Token allocation refers to how many tokens a user will gain from interacting with 'DocumentRegistration'
